legacyCollection.name: Sports
legacyCollection.longDescription: Find breaking news, features and analysis on the NFL, NBA, MLB, golf, tennis, soccer, NCAA, NHL, World Series, Super Bowl, Olympics, World Cup and more.

headline.default: Snowmobiles in Slush: Sports Are on Thin Ice in the Warming Arctic

asset.summary: Skiing, hiking and dogsledding will never be the same in Svalbard, Norway, which has warmed more than twice as quickly as the rest of the Arctic. The islands may be isolated, but the changes aren’t.

headline.default: FIFA Picks First Women Officials for Men’s World Cup

asset.summary: The three referees and three assistant referees are the first to be picked for the top men’s soccer tournament, which will be held in Qatar this year.

caption.text: Stephanie Frappart made history earlier this month when she took charge of the French cup final. She and two other women were among the 36 referees selected for the Qatar World Cup.

headline.default: Golden State’s Andrew Wiggins Isn’t Who You Thought He Was

asset.summary: Wiggins, the No. 1 overall draft pick in 2014, had developed a reputation as a bust. Coming to Golden State has helped him finally tap his potential.

caption.text: Golden State’s Andrew Wiggins scored 19 points and helped limit Luka Doncic in Game 1 of the Western Conference finals on Wednesday night.

headline.default: Jordan Spieth Is Muttering Less and Smiling More

asset.summary: And why not? After a couple of years of uncharacteristically mediocre play, he sees an opportunity at the P.G.A. Championship to complete a career Grand Slam.

caption.text: Jordan Spieth practiced Wednesday on the driving range at the P.G.A. Championship.

headline.default: What We Expected (and Didn’t Expect) in the Rangers-Hurricanes Game

asset.summary: A close game? Yes. A Hurricanes win? Sure. But it was hard to predict that the Rangers would outplay Carolina and still lose.

caption.text: Ian Cole was an unexpected hero for the Carolina Hurricanes in Wednesday’s win over the Rangers.

headline.default: How U.S. Soccer and Its Players Solved the Equal Pay Puzzle

asset.summary: New contracts for the men’s and women’s national teams will usher in an era of equal pay at U.S. Soccer. Here’s how it will work.

headline.default: A Mets Outfielder Gets an Up-Close Look at Payroll Disparity

asset.summary: After seven years with the penny-pinching Oakland Athletics, Mark Canha is enjoying life on the Mets’ unlimited payroll.

caption.text: Mark Canha spent seven years with the Oakland Athletics. He was part of the Mets’ off-season overhaul.

promotionalMedia.credit: Geoff Burke/USA Today Sports, via Reuters

headline.default: Max Scherzer Leaves Early With Discomfort in Mets Win

asset.summary: Scherzer will get an M.R.I. after the Mets beat St. Louis. The Yankees, meanwhile, beat Baltimore with baserunning and defense.

caption.text: Max Scherzer asked to be taked out during the sixth inning because of discomfort in his left side.

headline.default: By Land and by Air, the Destination Was Seville

asset.summary: When Glasgow Rangers and Eintracht Frankfurt headed to Spain for the Europa League final, tens of thousands of their fans followed.

headline.default: U.S. Soccer and Top Players Agree to Guarantee Equal Pay

asset.summary: Landmark labor agreements with members of the men’s and women’s national teams will include higher paychecks and shared World Cup prize money.

caption.text: The United States women won a World Cup championship and an Olympic bronze medal during their six-year fight for equal pay.

headline.default: Expert Picks: Who Will Win the Preakness?

asset.summary: Joe Drape and Melissa Hoppert look at the contenders for the 147th Preakness Stakes.

caption.text: Rich Strike, right, with Sonny Leon aboard, slipped past Epicenter, ridden by Joel Rosario, to win the Kentucky Derby. Rich Strike will miss the Preakness, where Epicenter is a favorite to win.

headline.default: The Stats Are Hiding a Secret About the Miami Heat’s P.J. Tucker

asset.summary: Tucker did a little bit of everything in a Game 1 win over the Boston Celtics in the Eastern Conference finals — including help neutralize Jayson Tatum.

caption.text: Miami’s P.J. Tucker made a bigger impact on Game 1 of the Eastern Conference finals than his tally of points and rebounds showed. “He does all the right things,” Heat Coach Erik Spoelstra said.

headline.default: ‘I Believe in Legacies’: Woods Chides Mickelson on the Eve of a Major

asset.summary: In remarks before the P.G.A. Championship, Tiger Woods distanced himself from his longtime rival, Phil Mickelson, who stirred controversy with his support of an upstart Saudi-backed golf tour.

caption.text: Tiger Woods played a practice round on Monday at Southern Hills Country Club in Tulsa, Okla. The P.G.A. Championship begins there on Thursday.

headline.default: In N.H.L. Playoffs, a Canadian Divide Between Winners and Losers

asset.summary: The Maple Leafs set a record for futility, but the Oilers and the Flames made up for it. They will meet in a postseason Battle of Alberta for the first time in more than 30 years.

caption.text: From left, Oilers center Connor McDavid, Leafs center Auston Matthews and Flames left winger Johnny Gaudreau.

promotionalMedia.credit: From left, Jeff Mcintosh/The Canadian Press, via Associated Press; Frank Gunn/The Canadian Press, via Associated Press; Derek Leung/Getty Images

asset.html: Get the big sports news, highlights and analysis from Times journalists, with distinctive takes on games and some behind-the-scenes surprises, delivered to your inbox every week.
